news.title: Neighbours tell how woman attacked with axe ran bleeding from burning home
news.summary: Neighbours of a woman (50s) who was attacked by a man who broke into her home and then set it alight, have told how she ran bleeding from the burning house.

news.title: Mortgage demand drives credit union lending to a record high
news.summary: Demand for mortgages has pushed overall lending at the State’s credit unions to a record level. The sector has seen a 28pc surge in mortgage lending in the year to September when compared with last year.

news.title: Jozef Puska’s wife and wives of his two brothers segregated in Mountjoy over attack fears
news.summary: Three women jailed for withholding information during the Ashling Murphy murder probe have been segregated in the Dochas Women’s Prison and are being kept under 23-hour lockdown for their own protection.

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘I have saved over €10,000 for my grandchildren, where should I store it to earn the most interest?’
Operation renovation: ‘My home is a big experiment – anything goes if it feels like me’
news.summary: When Dublin creative Joanne Mooney bought her four-bed, semi-detached home in Swords in 2003, she wasn’t thinking about architectural statements or design manifestos.

news.title: ‘Certain people seem to have their way with how game is going’ – Johnny Sexton says law changes weren’t thought through
news.summary: As a player, Johnny Sexton would probably have made the most out of rugby’s new direction centred around a kick-heavy approach.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Four wills, three years and the €3m stud farm – Inside the battle for Des Vere Hunt's estate
news.summary: When Des Vere Hunt, of Garraun, Fethard, Co Tipperary passed away in September 2021, he left behind him a stud farm worth over €3 million euros. He also left behind four wills. An announcement read:

news.title: ‘It's a story of endurance and culture’ – Inside this Galway man’s historic 1,468km swim around Ireland
news.summary: After five months and 17 days, 1,468km in the water and more moments of grit than he can count, Daragh Morgan has become the first person to complete a tidal-assisted swim around the entire coast of Ireland.

news.title: Becoming a mum after 45: ‘Women like me are having children a lot later in life and it is amazing’
news.summary: The average age for motherhood in Ireland is 33.2, according to the Central Statistics Office (CSO), but its most recent figures also reveal that an increasing number of women are waiting until they are a lot older before becoming first-time mothers.

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: Ireland must strike the right balance on immigration
news.summary: News that asylum-seekers may have to contribute between 10pc and 40pc of their weekly income towards their state accommodation costs may cause unease among some. The proposal will be considered by the Cabinet today.
